conversation.ja_sentence: はい、K社システム開発部です。
conversation.en_sentence: Hi this is the systems development department of Company K.

conversation.ja_sentence: こちらこそ、お世話になっております。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you as always as well.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、代わります。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, let me switch you over.

conversation.ja_sentence: 少々お待ちください。
conversation.en_sentence: Please wait a moment.

conversation.ja_sentence: 稲田さん、H社の高市様からお電話です。
conversation.en_sentence: Inada-san, you have a call from Mr. Takaichi of Company H.

conversation.ja_sentence: 基本的に株主さんからの質問については、議長である私が回答すべきと思っているよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I think I should generally be answering the questions from the shareholders as I am the chairman.

conversation.ja_sentence: でも、株主さんから、特定の取締役を指名して回答要求された場合はどうすればいい？
conversation.en_sentence: But what should we do if the shareholders would like the questions answered by a specific director?

conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました、その方向でいこう。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, let's go with that.

conversation.ja_sentence: 君らが株主役だと、本番以上に辛辣な質問を浴びることになりそうだね。
conversation.en_sentence: If you guys are the shareholders, I think we will be showered with tougher questions than the real thing.

conversation.ja_sentence: お手柔らかに頼むよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Please go easy on us.

conversation.ja_sentence: 河本ですね。
conversation.en_sentence: You want Kawamoto?

conversation.ja_sentence: ご用件をお伺いしてよろしいでしょうか。
conversation.en_sentence: May I ask what this is about?

conversation.ja_sentence: かしこまりました。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay.

conversation.ja_sentence: 少々お待ちくださいませ。
conversation.en_sentence: Please wait a moment.

conversation.ja_sentence: 河本へおつなぎ致します。
conversation.en_sentence: I will transfer you to Kawamoto.

conversation.ja_sentence: B社の高田です。
conversation.en_sentence: This is Takada from Company B

conversation.ja_sentence: 広報の白木さんをお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: May I speak to Shiroki-san from public relations?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、お願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, please.

conversation.ja_sentence: 折り返し電話してもらうようにお願いできますでしょうか。
conversation.en_sentence: Can you tell him to call me back?

conversation.ja_sentence: xx-xxxx-xxxxです。
conversation.en_sentence: It is xx-xxxx-xxxx.

conversation.ja_sentence: 本日はお招きいただき、ありがとうございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much for inviting me today.

conversation.ja_sentence: なるほど。
conversation.en_sentence: I see.

conversation.ja_sentence: それも一つの案ですね。
conversation.en_sentence: That is an idea as well.

conversation.ja_sentence: なるほど。
conversation.en_sentence: I see.

conversation.ja_sentence: しかしそれには、時間をかなり要しそうですね。
conversation.en_sentence: But, that could take some time.

conversation.ja_sentence: うん、大丈夫だよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Sure, I'm okay.

conversation.ja_sentence: どうした。
conversation.en_sentence: What's wrong?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうか、見てみよう。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, let's see.

conversation.ja_sentence: わかった。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay.

conversation.ja_sentence: 目を通したらまた呼ぶから。
conversation.en_sentence: I'll let you know once I finish reading it.

conversation.ja_sentence: 規則では飲み会などがあるときは一旦鞄を自宅に置いて出かけることになっているのに。
conversation.en_sentence: But isn't it in the rules that if you're going out you should leave your belongings at home first?

conversation.ja_sentence: 先月は結局カードは見つかったんでしたっけ？
conversation.en_sentence: Well, did that card ever show up again?

conversation.ja_sentence: いえ、どれだけ重要か知ってたとしても多分またやるでしょうね。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, I think it'll happen again even if they know how important it is.

conversation.ja_sentence: それではJ事業部だけにやるとして、何か案はありますか？
conversation.en_sentence: OK, then let's come up with a plan just for division J.

conversation.ja_sentence: 朝早めにJ事業部のリーダー数名に出勤してもらってやりましょう。
conversation.en_sentence: We need to tell the division J leaders that they need to come in earlier so that they can begin this process.

conversation.ja_sentence: 管理会社と交渉して賃料を削減してもらうって頼むのかい？
conversation.en_sentence: Are you going to negotiate with the management company and ask for a rent reduction?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうすると年間600万の経費削減ですね。
conversation.en_sentence: So that's a cost reduction of 6 million yen per year.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私も賛成です。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm good too.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうは言っても社用車は営業社員のために必要だろう。
conversation.en_sentence: But we need the company cars for the sales team.

conversation.ja_sentence: あとは営業部の売上ミーティングでどこまでの売上アップが見込めるかですね。
conversation.en_sentence: I guess we have to see how much the sales can increase with the discussion of sales among the sales team.

conversation.ja_sentence: いや実は私、昼は食べてないんですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Actually, I don't eat lunch.

conversation.ja_sentence: 医者から体脂肪がやばいからなんとかしろって言われてまして。
conversation.en_sentence: My doctor said I'm getting a bit obese and told me to take this seriously.

conversation.ja_sentence: それでお昼は公園の周りをぐるぐるウォーキングしてるんです。
conversation.en_sentence: So I am just walking around the area around the park during lunch.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今携帯で調べてるんですけどこの辺あまり飲食店無いですねえ。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm looking it up on my phone but it seems there aren't a lot of restaurants around here.

conversation.ja_sentence: 確か公園の近くにお蕎麦屋さんがあったような気がするんだけど。
conversation.en_sentence: I thought there was a soba restaurant near the park.

conversation.ja_sentence: 残業したくないからみんな焦るよね。
conversation.en_sentence: We are all rushing not to do overtime.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうなんだ。
conversation.en_sentence: Really?

conversation.ja_sentence: ご苦労様です。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm sorry to hear that.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうなんだ...。
conversation.en_sentence: That's a bummer...

conversation.ja_sentence: ひえー、土日どちらも休みなしはきついね。
conversation.en_sentence: Wow, that's bit too crazy not to be able to rest Saturday or Sunday.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私の営業部では営業担当者の記録の整理をやってもらえるかと思います。
conversation.en_sentence: At my sales department, I think they can organize the documents of our sales people.

conversation.ja_sentence: 我々の営業記録ツールの使い方はすぐに覚えてくれると思いますし。
conversation.en_sentence: I think they can learn how to use our sales tool quickly.

conversation.ja_sentence: それはいいタイミングですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Isn't it a good timing?

conversation.ja_sentence: 確かにどの部でも英語は必要になりますね。
conversation.en_sentence: Indeed, English is required at any department.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、異議ありません。
conversation.en_sentence: I don't have any problem.

conversation.ja_sentence: うーん、まず敬語の研修をやったほうがいいんじゃないですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Well, shouldn't we provide a training how to speak polite Japanese first?

conversation.ja_sentence: マーケティング部ではソーシャルサービスのアップデートをやってもらいたいですね。
conversation.en_sentence: At the marketing department, I want them to update our social service accounts.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今も学生アルバイトにやってもらってますが、彼が６月いっぱいで辞めてしまうんですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Currently, I have a part time worker who is a student to do the job, but he is leaving at the end of June.

conversation.ja_sentence: 正規採用になったら、その仕事にはまたアルバイトを雇いますけど。
conversation.en_sentence: However, if they are ever officially hired, we will get a part-time worker for that job.

conversation.ja_sentence: うちの会社は就職志望先の上位にあるから、インターン希望者も多数くるんじゃないかしら。
conversation.en_sentence: As our company is listed in the top group as a desired company to work for, we may expect to get many people applying for internship.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私の部の何人かは１５日に出張に出るので１３日はどうですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Some members in my department are leaving for business trips on the fifteenth, so how about on the thirteenth?

conversation.ja_sentence: 私の知り合いがケータリングをやってますが、聞いてみましょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: I know someone who does catering, shall I ask her?

conversation.ja_sentence: 彼女は地中海風のメニューが得意だったはず。
conversation.en_sentence: I think her specialty is Mediterranean food.

conversation.ja_sentence: 明日には見積もりをもらえると思うので、皆さんにメールします。
conversation.en_sentence: I think I can get an estimate tomorrow, so I will e-mail it to all of you.

conversation.ja_sentence: それぐらいやらないと盛り上がらないだろうし。
conversation.en_sentence: It might not be as exciting if we don't do it.

conversation.ja_sentence: 田中君、お願いしていた売上報告書は完成してるかい？
conversation.en_sentence: Hi Mr. Tanaka, have you finished the report on product sales that I asked for?

conversation.ja_sentence: いつ頃終わるかな？
conversation.en_sentence: When do think it will be finished?

conversation.ja_sentence: 金曜日の3時に新規の見込み客とのミーティングがあって、その時のプレゼンで報告書を使いたいんだよ。
conversation.en_sentence: On Friday at three, I have a meeting with a potential new client and I would like to use the report in my presentation.

conversation.ja_sentence: 金曜日の1時までに仕上げることはできるかい？
conversation.en_sentence: Do you think you could have it ready by one o'clock this Friday?

conversation.ja_sentence: どうもありがとう。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you, I appreciate it.

conversation.ja_sentence: 伊藤様と山田様はお連れ様みたい。
conversation.en_sentence: It seems Mr. Ito and Mr. Yamada are colleagues.

conversation.ja_sentence: それで、伊藤様の方が役職が上みたい。
conversation.en_sentence: And it seems Mr. Ito is the higher ranked executive.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうしましょう。
conversation.en_sentence: Let's do that.

conversation.ja_sentence: 念の為伝えておきましょう。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes we should share this with them just in case.

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとう。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、先月から営業に入った松川です、よろしくお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, I am Takashi and I started last month in the sales, nice meeting you.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、まだ一ヶ月ですが、他の部署の皆さんからもよくしていただいています。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, it's been only one month, but people from other departments have been nice to me.

conversation.ja_sentence: ちょうど先日、うちの部署でその話が出たところでした。
conversation.en_sentence: We just talked about that in our department the other day.

conversation.ja_sentence: その点は上司からしっかりと聞かされています。
conversation.en_sentence: My boss has assured me that I knew about it.

conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました。
conversation.en_sentence: Got it.

conversation.ja_sentence: マーケティングの高野です。
conversation.en_sentence: I am Harumi from marketing.

conversation.ja_sentence: 先月15日の入社です、よろしくお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: I started on the 15th of last month, pleasure to meet you.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私は留学から帰国後初めての仕事になるのですが、すぐに勘を取り戻すことができました。
conversation.en_sentence: This is my first job after coming home from studying abroad, but I got my work instinct back quickly.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私はまだです。
conversation.en_sentence: Not yet.

conversation.ja_sentence: 分からない部分は後で質問していいですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Can I ask you questions later if there is something I don't understand?

conversation.ja_sentence: おはようございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Good morning.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、部屋の後ろに座っても、ちゃんと聞こえるように設定してあります。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, we set it up in a way you can hear well even if you sit in the back of the room.

conversation.ja_sentence: スピーカーの数も増やしておきました。
conversation.en_sentence: We added the number of speakers, too.

conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、昨日確認した時は問題なしでした。
conversation.en_sentence: Good, there was no problem when we checked it yesterday.

conversation.ja_sentence: あとで、会議直前に再確認しますが。
conversation.en_sentence: We will double check right before the meeting later.

conversation.ja_sentence: すみません、事業企画部、但馬です。
conversation.en_sentence: Excuse me, I'm Yu, in business planning.

conversation.ja_sentence: 中間研修は各所責任者が管理し、部の予算内で行ってきました。
conversation.en_sentence: Training for long-term employees has been under the management of each section head, and they've been held within our divisional budget.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今後は人事が全て実施するという事でしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: Would they all be conducted by the HR from now on?

conversation.ja_sentence: では、各部署で研修計画を決められるとの認識で宜しいでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: So, that's each division to decide on training plans, am I right?

conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました。
conversation.en_sentence: I understand.

conversation.ja_sentence: お話中すみません、失礼します。
conversation.en_sentence: Excuse me, sorry to disturb you while talking.

conversation.ja_sentence: 遅れて申し訳ありません。
conversation.en_sentence: My apologies for being late.

conversation.ja_sentence: 商品開発部の大野です。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm Mamoru from the Product Development Department.

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.

conversation.ja_sentence: すみません、前を失礼いたします。
conversation.en_sentence: Sorry, excuse my passing in front of you.

conversation.ja_sentence: 社内掲示板って？
conversation.en_sentence: What's in-house bulletin board?

conversation.ja_sentence: あ、僕はたまにバイクで来てます。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, I come here by bike sometime.

conversation.ja_sentence: え、何か問題があるんですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, is there a problem?

conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました、部長。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, Soji.

conversation.ja_sentence: お話中断してすみませんでした。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm sorry to interrupt.

conversation.ja_sentence: 現在無断で自転車通勤している外国人が数名いる模様です。
conversation.en_sentence: Currently, there seem to be a few foreigners who have been bicycle commuting without permission.

conversation.ja_sentence: 他にもこちらで把握出来ていない社員もいる可能性がある為、申請ルールを社内に周知したいと考えています。
conversation.en_sentence: There might be more of them whom we haven't been able to grasp, so we'd like to notify the application rules to the whole company.

conversation.ja_sentence: 周知内容は公共交通機関通勤の推奨、申請方法と承認条件、通勤路、駐車駐輪についてとなります。
conversation.en_sentence: The notice will be about recommendation for public transportation commuting, application procedures and conditions for approval, commuting routes, and parking for cars and bikes.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今月末までに社内掲示板にアップします。
conversation.en_sentence: We're putting it up on the intranet bulletin board by the end of the month.

conversation.ja_sentence: 告知内容は英語でも作成予定です。
conversation.en_sentence: We will have the notice in English as well.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今月末に行われるメンバーさんの慰労会の開催場所が、横浜みなとみらいのCホテルのコンベンションルームに決まりました。
conversation.en_sentence: It has been decided that the venue for the thank you party for members at the end of the month will be at the convention room of Hotel C in Yokohama Minato Mirai.

conversation.ja_sentence: 総括していただく吉川さんより、詳細について報告していただきます。
conversation.en_sentence: I will have Yoshikawa-kun who is in charge of this to explain the details.

conversation.ja_sentence: タブレットはいかがですか？
conversation.en_sentence: How about a tablet?

conversation.ja_sentence: お食事のコースは決定しましたか？
conversation.en_sentence: Have we decided on the course menu for the meals?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですか、楽しみですね。
conversation.en_sentence: I see, I look forward to it.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今日の1時に予定されている会議に使う予定の模型がまだ届いていませんが、主任の方に何か連絡は届いていますか？
conversation.en_sentence: The model that we plan on using for the meeting at 1 o'clock hasn't arrived yet but has the manager heard anything about it?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、わかりました。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, sure.

conversation.ja_sentence: かしこまりました。
conversation.en_sentence: Got it.

conversation.ja_sentence: 主任、会議室はCで予約を取ってありますが、２０席しかないのでBの会議室へ移動しますか？
conversation.en_sentence: Tanaka-san, we have meeting room C booked but it only has 20 seats so should we move to meeting room B?

conversation.ja_sentence: 承知しました。
conversation.en_sentence: I understand.

conversation.ja_sentence: 契約社員の方でも構いませんか？
conversation.en_sentence: Will contract employees be okay as well?

conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay.

conversation.ja_sentence: では早速何人か声をかけておきますね。
conversation.en_sentence: I'll go and talk to some people.

conversation.ja_sentence: うちは番組の問い合わせなどが午後に集中するので、できれば午前中にそちらで作業していただけると助かります。
conversation.en_sentence: We usually have a lot of inquiries on the show in the afternoon so it would be great if you can handle it in the morning.

conversation.ja_sentence: お疲れ様でした。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、少々お待ちください。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, please wait a moment.

conversation.ja_sentence: コーヒーとお茶はどちらがよろしいですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Would you like tea or coffee?

conversation.ja_sentence: 承知しました。
conversation.en_sentence: Certainly.

conversation.ja_sentence: 佐藤部長はどうなさいますか？
conversation.en_sentence: And what would you like Director Sato?

conversation.ja_sentence: 承知しました、少々お待ちください。
conversation.en_sentence: Certainly, I'll bring those over in a moment.

conversation.ja_sentence: 田中さん、いつもお世話になってます。
conversation.en_sentence: Tanaka-san, good to see you.

conversation.ja_sentence: いえいえ、大変でしたね。
conversation.en_sentence: Not at all, you must've had a hard time.

conversation.ja_sentence: こちらの部屋へどうぞ。
conversation.en_sentence: If you'd like to go into this room.

conversation.ja_sentence: 僕もコーヒーでお願いできるかな？
conversation.en_sentence: Um, may I have a coffee as well?

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとう。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.

conversation.ja_sentence: 田中さん、遅くなってごめんなさい。
conversation.en_sentence: Tanaka-san, sorry this has taken such a long time.

conversation.ja_sentence: A社への見積、今データ送りましたので見ていただけますか？
conversation.en_sentence: I've just sent you the data for the quote to Company A, could you have a look at it for me please?

conversation.ja_sentence: 宜しくお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: Thanks.

conversation.ja_sentence: 承知しました。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay.

conversation.ja_sentence: すぐに対応します。
conversation.en_sentence: I'll do that right away.

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今確認するので少々お待ちください。
conversation.en_sentence: I'll take a look now, hold on a moment.

conversation.ja_sentence: 数字は問題なさそうですが、見積もりの日付を今日に変更してもらっても良いですか？
conversation.en_sentence: The numbers seem fine, but would you mind changing the date on the quote to today?

conversation.ja_sentence: そこを変更してもらえれば、先方に送ってもらって大丈夫です。
conversation.en_sentence: If you just make that change, it'll be fine to send to the other party.

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます！
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you!

conversation.ja_sentence: すみません、まだB社からの回答待ちです。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm sorry, I'm still waiting for a response from Company B.

conversation.ja_sentence: 4日前です。
conversation.en_sentence: Four days ago.

conversation.ja_sentence: すみません。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm sorry.

conversation.ja_sentence: すぐに電話します。
conversation.en_sentence: I'll phone them now.

conversation.ja_sentence: 承知しました。
conversation.en_sentence: Alright.

conversation.ja_sentence: M社の吉田と申します。
conversation.en_sentence: My name is Yoshida from Company M.

conversation.ja_sentence: いつもお世話になっております。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you as always.

conversation.ja_sentence: 御社の製品Aのことでおたずねしたいのですが、ご担当の方をお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: I'd like to ask about your company's Product A, can you transfer me to someone in charge?

conversation.ja_sentence: 価格も知りたいんですけど、製品全般に関することで・・・
conversation.en_sentence: I want to know the price as well, but also in regards to the product in general.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、お願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, thank you.

conversation.ja_sentence: 社員の数を増やしたのが原因ですかね。
conversation.en_sentence: I wonder if it was because we have more employees now.

conversation.ja_sentence: うわー、これは凄いな。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, this is something!

conversation.ja_sentence: またこの夏も暑くなるだろうし。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm sure it will be hot again this summer.

conversation.ja_sentence: いっそのこと、これを機に新調するのがいいでしょうかね。
conversation.en_sentence: Then it might be smart to replace it at this opportunity.

conversation.ja_sentence: いつまでに決める必要がありますか？
conversation.en_sentence: By when do we need to make the decision?

conversation.ja_sentence: 当社で検討している研磨機もあるじゃないですか。
conversation.en_sentence: They have the polisher that we're thinking about purchasing.

conversation.ja_sentence: うちと変わらないですね。
conversation.en_sentence: About the same as us.

conversation.ja_sentence: でも、あっちのほうが効率がいいのは、やっぱり設備の差でしょうか。
conversation.en_sentence: So, it is because of the difference in the equipment that they are more efficient.

conversation.ja_sentence: 確か、有名な工業大学のそばでしたよね。
conversation.en_sentence: I believe it is close to the famous engineering university.

conversation.ja_sentence: うちの研究所の課題が見えてきた感じがします。
conversation.en_sentence: I think now I see what the issues are at our lab.

conversation.ja_sentence: 永井さんですね？
conversation.en_sentence: Ms. Nagai?

conversation.ja_sentence: 私があなたの上司の小島です。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm Kojima, your supervisor.

conversation.ja_sentence: よろしくお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: Nice to meet you.

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとう！
conversation.en_sentence: Perfect.

conversation.ja_sentence: 終わったら教えて下さいね。
conversation.en_sentence: Let me know when you finish.

conversation.ja_sentence: あー、知ってる、知ってる、懐かしい。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, yes, yes, I haven’t seen them for ages.

conversation.ja_sentence: ミューズリーは家族も好きだから、毎日食べてたわよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I used to have muesli every day, as my family loved it.

conversation.ja_sentence: 逆に日本にはあまり売っていないから、たまに恋しくなるわ。
conversation.en_sentence: We miss muesli as we can rarely buy it here.

conversation.ja_sentence: ナッツとか乾燥フルーツとか入っていて美味しいわよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, it’s very nice, with nuts and dried fruits.

conversation.ja_sentence: やはり、消費者教育マーケティングが必要ですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, it depends on the marketing focus on consumer education, I guess.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、自炊案ですが、これは難しいかと思います。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, about the self-catering, I doubt it’ll work.

conversation.ja_sentence: せっかく英国に来るので、英国料理を調達するとか、地元のパブやフィシュアンドチップス屋などに連れて行くのはどうでしょうか。
conversation.en_sentence: How about catering British food or take the students to local pubs or fish and chips shops, as they come all the way from Japan to England.

conversation.ja_sentence: ２週間の短期コースですから、それほど日本食にこだわる人はあまりいないかと。
conversation.en_sentence: It’s only a two-week course, they will be okay without Japanese food.

conversation.ja_sentence: それに、料理嫌いな人もいるし、知らない生徒同士でキッチンをうまくシェアできるかもわかりませんし。
conversation.en_sentence: Also, some may feel awkward with cooking, and they may have problems with sharing the kitchen as they don’t know each other well.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, Dr. Scott.

conversation.ja_sentence: その番組について、もうちょっと説明してくれるかね？
conversation.en_sentence: Can you tell me more about the programme?

conversation.ja_sentence: なるほど。
conversation.en_sentence: I see.

conversation.ja_sentence: そんな番組があるんだね。
conversation.en_sentence: Hmm, you have such programmes in Japan.

conversation.ja_sentence: おもしろいね、ありがとう。
conversation.en_sentence: That’s interesting, thank you.

conversation.ja_sentence: 大丈夫です。
conversation.en_sentence: Nothing, so far.

conversation.ja_sentence: こんにちは、今日からここで働くことになった恵子スペンサーです。
conversation.en_sentence: Hello, my name is Keiko Spencer, and I’m supposed to start working here today.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay.

conversation.ja_sentence: ええっ？
conversation.en_sentence: What?

conversation.ja_sentence: はあ、では、とりあえずどうしたらいいでしょう？
conversation.en_sentence: Um, Okay, then, what shall I do?

conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました、マネジャーと話しをしてきます。
conversation.en_sentence: Right, I’ll have a word with the manager.

conversation.ja_sentence: それはおめでとうございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Congratulations!

conversation.ja_sentence: 予定日はいつですか？
conversation.en_sentence: When are you due?

conversation.ja_sentence: そしたら、3月の終わり頃から産前産後休暇が始まりますね。
conversation.en_sentence: So your maternity leave would start around the end of March, right?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、引き継ぎもあるので、小宮さんがお休みの間に代わりになる人を早めにアサインしましょう。
conversation.en_sentence: Sure, you'll also have work to delegate, so we should assign it to the person who will take over during your absence soon.

conversation.ja_sentence: では、年明けに小宮さんの上長と話をして、後任の人を決めましょう。
conversation.en_sentence: Well then, at the start of the year, let's talk with your manager and decide your successor.

conversation.ja_sentence: いらっしゃいませ。
conversation.en_sentence: Welcome.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、ありがとうございました。
conversation.en_sentence: OK, thank you.

conversation.ja_sentence: それはたいへん失礼しました。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh my, I'm very sorry.

conversation.ja_sentence: レシートはお持ちですか？
conversation.en_sentence: May I see the receipt?

conversation.ja_sentence: 何だったの?
conversation.en_sentence: What was that?

conversation.ja_sentence: やあ、久しぶり。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, long time no talk.

conversation.ja_sentence: 構わないよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Sure thing.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうだな、明後日はどうかな？
conversation.en_sentence: Hmm, how about the day after tomorrow?

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ午後で頼むよ。
conversation.en_sentence: How about in the afternoon.

conversation.ja_sentence: ああ。
conversation.en_sentence: Sounds good.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私は防犯カメラの設置については反対ですね。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm against the installation of a security camera.

conversation.ja_sentence: 防犯カメラを設置するコストに見合いません。
conversation.en_sentence: The issue doesn't justify the cost of installing another security camera.

conversation.ja_sentence: これまで通り、見回りの回数を増やす対応でいいんじゃないでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: Can we not just deal with it the way we always have, by increasing the number of patrols?

conversation.ja_sentence: 勤務時間外の会議は避けていただけないでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: Can we avoid having meetings outside of work hours?

conversation.ja_sentence: 子どもを保育園に迎えに行く時間に間に合わなくなってしまいます。
conversation.en_sentence: It makes me unable to make it in time to collect my child from nursery.
Excuse me, my program won't open.
conversation.ja_sentence: すみません、プログラムが開かないんですが。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, and I was able to open the program, so I'm up to speed.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、プログラムを開けました、今追いついているところです。

conversation.en_sentence: What's a table?
conversation.ja_sentence: テーブルって何ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: What is a watermark?
conversation.ja_sentence: ウォーターマークって何ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Why would you use that?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何に使用するんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: I have noticed it too.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私も気づいていました。

conversation.en_sentence: Is there anything different that happened in the last few months?
conversation.ja_sentence: ここ数か月の間に何か変化があったのですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Our sales has gone up by 65% thanks to the popular vlogger introduced our online store in one of her videos.
conversation.ja_sentence: でもあの有名なブロガーがビデオでうちの会社を紹介して以来、６５%も販売数が増えましたよ。

conversation.en_sentence: It's understandable.
conversation.ja_sentence: 理解できますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: That sure is a waste of time.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは時間の無駄ですね。

conversation.en_sentence: Great to have you here.
conversation.ja_sentence: 良く来てくれましたね。

conversation.en_sentence: Please tell us all about it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 詳しく教えて下さい。

conversation.en_sentence: Does it clean as well as you claim it does?
conversation.ja_sentence: 仰る通り、ちゃんと汚れを取るんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: I actually have tried a few of those all-natural cleaners in the past.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今まで自然素材クリーナーを幾つか使用しました。

conversation.en_sentence: I was not satisfied with their performance.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも性能に満足できませんでした。

conversation.en_sentence: Hi, what can I help you with?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうしましたか？

conversation.en_sentence: Let me restart the printer.
conversation.ja_sentence: 一度電源を切ってみましょう。

conversation.en_sentence: Sometimes it works when you do that.
conversation.ja_sentence: それで解決する事もあります。

conversation.en_sentence: Anytime!
conversation.ja_sentence: いつでも呼んでください。

conversation.en_sentence: It's my job to help you with problems like this.
conversation.ja_sentence: こんな時に助けるのが私の仕事です。

conversation.en_sentence: May or June, yeah that sounds about right.
conversation.ja_sentence: 5月か6月、そうだね、その頃だよね。

conversation.en_sentence: July!
You guys over in programming are really making it difficult for us in the sales department.
conversation.ja_sentence: 君らがプログラミングに時間を取り過ぎるから営業部が大変な目にあうんだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: You always have to rub it in, don't you Walt.
conversation.ja_sentence: 君はいつもわざとらしく言うよね、ウォルト。

conversation.en_sentence: You know I'm a Boston fan.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私がボストンのファンだと知ってるでくせに。

conversation.en_sentence: If a person is unable to evacuate a building due to a physical disability, what steps should be taken?
conversation.ja_sentence: 体に障害がある人が建物から自力で避難することができない場合、どうしたら良いですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Stan, that seems rather bleak to leave someone there.
conversation.ja_sentence: スタン、誰かを置いて逃げるのは厳しいと思うんですけど。

conversation.en_sentence: Where can we be trained how to properly use the fire extinguisher?
conversation.ja_sentence: 消火器の使い方はどこで訓練できますか。

conversation.en_sentence: What are those?
conversation.ja_sentence: AクラスCクラスってなんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: What do you mean by agent?
conversation.ja_sentence: 消火剤って何ですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ホゼ マルティネス
conversation.en_sentence: He seems like the brightest one of all.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼、一番賢そうですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ホゼ マルティネス
conversation.en_sentence: I really liked how articulate and confident he was at the interview.
conversation.ja_sentence: 面接の時、明確で自信たっぷりだった所が気に入りました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ホゼ マルティネス
conversation.en_sentence: I can totally picture him leading our marketing team.
conversation.ja_sentence: 我が社のマーケティングチームを引っ張ってくれるのが想像できます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ホゼ マルティネス
conversation.en_sentence: His resume says he interned there for 2 and a half years.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼の履歴書によると、そこで二年半インターンをしたそうです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ホゼ マルティネス
conversation.en_sentence: I really liked Ben, but Sanjay seems like a better suit.
conversation.ja_sentence: 本当はベンさんが良かったんですが、この職にはサンジェイさんが最適のようですね。

conversation.en_sentence: Hey, what happened to the computer?
conversation.ja_sentence: ねえ、パソコンどうした？

conversation.en_sentence: Let me call Tommy in the IT department.
conversation.ja_sentence: IT部のトミーさんを呼んでみよう。

conversation.en_sentence: If there is a glitch in the system, he is the right guy to call.
conversation.ja_sentence: システムに問題発生した時は、彼を呼ぶのが一番だよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Ok, Tommy should be here in 15 minutes or so.
conversation.ja_sentence: オッケー、15分くらいでトミーさんが来てくれるはずだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: He is finishing up a repair at the front desk.
conversation.ja_sentence: フロントデスクでの修理がもう少しで終わるらしいよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hi I'm Ben Sherman.
conversation.ja_sentence: こんにちは、ベン シャーマンです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm the manager and Sam is the sales representative in our department.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私はマネージャーで、サムはうちの部署の営業担当です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hey Sam, how about we start with Andy telling us a bit more about himself.
conversation.ja_sentence: なぁ、サム、アンディさんにもっと御自身のことについて話してもらうとこから始めたらどうかな。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: So why did you decide to apply for this position at our company?
conversation.ja_sentence: では、なぜ弊社のこのポジションに応募を決められたんでしょうか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Alright, let's go to the next question.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですか、では、次の質問へ進みましょう。

conversation.en_sentence: I agree with Mr. Cordero.
conversation.ja_sentence: コーデロさんの仰る通りです。

conversation.en_sentence: We should not be in a rush to release this product.
conversation.ja_sentence: 急いで商品発売しないほうがいいです。

conversation.en_sentence: We want to make sure our product surpasses theirs.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼らの品に勝る商品に仕上げたいですよね。

conversation.en_sentence: How about November?
conversation.ja_sentence: 11月はどうですか？

conversation.en_sentence: It should give us enough time for the testing.
conversation.ja_sentence: テスト期間も充分あります。

conversation.en_sentence: How come nobody told me about this.
conversation.ja_sentence: 誰からも聞いてないですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: You are going to make me cry!
conversation.ja_sentence: 泣けてきちゃいますね！

conversation.en_sentence: Well, I really enjoyed sharing my knowledge with you.
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたに色々教えてあげる事ができて楽しかったですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Replacing him will be a difficult task.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼の代わりを見つけるのは大変ですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Whoever gets hired will have big shoes to fill.
conversation.ja_sentence: 後任になった人は大役を務めないといけないですから。

conversation.en_sentence: You work just as hard, Mr. Taniguchi.
conversation.ja_sentence: 谷口さん、あなたも同じくらい真面目に働いていますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: You will be missed too.
conversation.ja_sentence: こっちも寂しくなってしまいますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Who is taking over Mr. Taniguchi's position by the way?
conversation.ja_sentence: ところで誰が谷口さんの後任者になるんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: I totally agree with you.
conversation.ja_sentence: その通りです。

conversation.en_sentence: They have no idea how lucky they are to have you.
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたを雇える事がどれだけラッキーかまだ彼らはわかってないでしょうね。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス ショウさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hi guys...
conversation.ja_sentence: やあ、みんな。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス ショウさん
conversation.en_sentence: No, I'm just getting coffee.
conversation.ja_sentence: いや、コーヒーを取りに来ただけだよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス ショウさん
conversation.en_sentence: What happened?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何かあったの？

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス ショウさん
conversation.en_sentence: ...And my almond milk is gone from the fridge!
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕のアーモンドミルクが冷蔵庫から消えてる！

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス ショウさん
conversation.en_sentence: Has anyone seen it?
conversation.ja_sentence: 誰か見た？

conversation.ja_speaker: アンジェラ カミングスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Did you see the market-close last night?
conversation.ja_sentence: 昨夜のマーケットクローズ見た？

conversation.ja_speaker: アンジェラ カミングスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Our stock had really good earnings' numbers last quarter and still it is down 5 percent from the beginning of the year!
conversation.ja_sentence: うちの株は前四半期に本当にいい利益を残したけど、年始からするとやはり５パーセント下がってるからね。

conversation.ja_speaker: アンジェラ カミングスさん
conversation.en_sentence: People in the office are going to be worried about year-end compensation.
conversation.ja_sentence: オフィスの皆が、年度末の手当について心配し始めるわね。

conversation.ja_speaker: アンジェラ カミングスさん
conversation.en_sentence: At least, there's still one more quarter left in the year...
conversation.ja_sentence: 少なくとも、今年まだあと一四半期残ってるわ。

conversation.ja_speaker: アンジェラ カミングスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Who knows what will happen to the market in these turbulent times?!
conversation.ja_sentence: この不穏な時期に、マーケットがどうなるかなんて誰にも分からないわよね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ピーター パーカーさん
conversation.en_sentence: That's fine, just let me know.
conversation.ja_sentence: 大丈夫ですよ、お知らせください。

conversation.ja_speaker: ピーター パーカーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hello, my name is Peter Parker.
conversation.ja_sentence: こんにちは、ピーターパーカーです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ピーター パーカーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Very nice to meet you both.
conversation.ja_sentence: お二人とお会いできて光栄です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ピーター パーカーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Fantastic, I've made copies for everyone.
conversation.ja_sentence: 素晴らしいです、皆さんにコピーを作っておきました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ピーター パーカーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Here they are.
conversation.ja_sentence: こちらです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ウィリアム キングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Of course, is now a good time?
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろん、今がいいですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ウィリアム キングさん
conversation.en_sentence: I have scheduled an update from the compliance department, followed by a full review of the financials.
conversation.ja_sentence: コンプライアンス部からのアップデート、その後で財政関係の全面見直しを予定しています。

conversation.ja_speaker: ウィリアム キングさん
conversation.en_sentence: We'll go over budgeted versus actual revenues, and of course review expenses for the year thus far.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私たちは、収益予測と実績を見直して、これまでの今年の支出を見直しましょう。

conversation.ja_speaker: ウィリアム キングさん
conversation.en_sentence: We can, but I'll need to get your sales assumptions first.
conversation.ja_sentence: できますけど、販売予測が先に必要です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ウィリアム キングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Do you know if travel arrangements been finalized for the directors?
conversation.ja_sentence: 部長たちの出張の最終予定はもうできてるんでしょうかね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジュリー ハウさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hi Peter, what can I do for you?
conversation.ja_sentence: あらピーター、何か手伝える？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジュリー ハウさん
conversation.en_sentence: That's a great idea.
conversation.ja_sentence: いい考えね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジュリー ハウさん
conversation.en_sentence: It's good for the team to be on the same page.
conversation.ja_sentence: チームとして合意しておくのはいいことね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジュリー ハウさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm good for any of those times.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私はどっちでもいけるわよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジュリー ハウさん
conversation.en_sentence: Sure thing, I can do that.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろん、やっとくわ。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, I am flattered.
conversation.ja_sentence: あら、それは光栄です。

conversation.en_sentence: You are abandoning us.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私たちを見捨てるのよね。

conversation.en_sentence: I have a right to be angry.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私には怒る権利があると思うわ。

conversation.en_sentence: I don't really care about increasing sales or being the best here.
conversation.ja_sentence: 売上を伸ばすとかここで一番になることとかには興味ないわ。

conversation.en_sentence: I just want a friendly work environment where I work with bright and decent people.
conversation.ja_sentence: 明るくて親切な人たちと楽しく働ける環境が欲しいだけ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Was that Tom from Company B?
conversation.ja_sentence: さっきのはB社のトムさんでしたか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: He was trying to get us to switch to his insurance company right?
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼は、私たちに保険会社を変えさせようとしていたんですよね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Well then, maybe it's a good idea to just turn him down.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃ、彼の話を断るのがいいと思いますよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I mean, our current insurance provider just gave us a decent rate reduction too.
conversation.ja_sentence: だって、今の保険会社の割引料金も理にかなってますからね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, that should be fine.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、いいですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for meeting with us today.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日はお会いしてくださってどうもありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: As explained in my email, I wanted to introduce Company A from Japan today.
conversation.ja_sentence: メールで説明した通り、今日は日本のA社さんをご紹介しに参りました。

conversation.en_sentence: And with me is Mr. Kenji Sano from Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: そして、私と一緒にいらしたのがA社の佐野健司さんです。

conversation.en_sentence: So maybe I'll have Mr. Sano start with his presentation, then maybe you can give us your presentation.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、まず佐野さんにプレゼンをお願いし、その後、そちらがプレゼンを、ということでよいでしょうか。

conversation.en_sentence: Alright, go ahead Mr. Sano.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、佐野さんお願いします。

conversation.en_sentence: So Misato, this is Elaine from our department.
conversation.ja_sentence: 美里さん、こちらが当部署のエレインさんです。

conversation.en_sentence: That's right.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね。

conversation.en_sentence: Ben handles more export business than I do so naturally, there will be more documentations involved.
conversation.ja_sentence: ベンさんは、私よりも多くの輸出業務を手掛けているので、自然に書類の数も多くなりますからね。

conversation.en_sentence: Alright, I'll have Elaine walk you through the documentation process.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、エレインさんに書類の処理について教えてもらってください。

conversation.en_sentence: Go easy on her, okay Elaine?
conversation.ja_sentence: あまり厳しくしないでよ、エレイン。

conversation.en_sentence: Not doing something illegal?
conversation.ja_sentence: 違法なことはしないとか？

conversation.en_sentence: That seems okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは大丈夫でしょう。

conversation.en_sentence: How do we know if a gift is too lavish or not?
conversation.ja_sentence: 贈答品が高価すぎるか、そうでないかの判断基準は？

conversation.en_sentence: I see.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for the advice.
conversation.ja_sentence: アドバイスをありがとうございました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Let's see.
conversation.ja_sentence: どれどれ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hmm, I haven't seen this one before.
conversation.ja_sentence: うーん、見たことないな。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It looks a bit different from the usual one.
conversation.ja_sentence: いつものとなんか違うような気がするし。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Maybe it'd be best if you call the IT department.
conversation.ja_sentence: ITチームに聞いた方がいいと思う。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: They should know what to do.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうしたらいいか教えくれるよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: イレーン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, this should be helpful for us.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、これは私たちの役に立ちそうですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: イレーン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: What if they start yelling at you?
conversation.ja_sentence: もし相手が怒鳴り始めたらどうしたらいいですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: イレーン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: What if they suddenly call you though?
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、突然電話がかかってきた場合はどうしたらいいですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: イレーン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you Ben!
conversation.ja_sentence: ベンさん、ありがとうございました！

conversation.ja_speaker: イレーン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Me too!
conversation.ja_sentence: 私もです！

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: Do we still have coffee?
conversation.ja_sentence: まだコーヒー残ってる？

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: あ、分かった。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: I'll come back.
conversation.ja_sentence: 後で戻ってくる。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm so sleepy right now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今、眠くて仕方ないよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: I already drank four cups of coffee.
conversation.ja_sentence: もう4杯もコーヒー飲んだのに。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah sure.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、もちろん。

conversation.en_sentence: I guess you won't be able to make it to the meeting this afternoon then.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、午後の会議には参加出来ないですよね。

conversation.en_sentence: Don't worry about it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 心配なさらないでください。

conversation.en_sentence: Company A is just dropping by to say hi and bringing their Christmas gift.
conversation.ja_sentence: A社の方が挨拶に来てクリスマスのプレゼントを持ってくれるだけですから。

conversation.en_sentence: I can handle it myself.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私だけで大丈夫です。

conversation.ja_speaker: キャメロン ジャイルズさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hi there, this is Company B.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、B社です。

conversation.ja_speaker: キャメロン ジャイルズさん
conversation.en_sentence: How may I help you.
conversation.ja_sentence: どのようなご用件でしょうか？

conversation.ja_speaker: キャメロン ジャイルズさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much for your interest.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご興味ありがとうございます。

conversation.ja_speaker: キャメロン ジャイルズさん
conversation.en_sentence: I can transfer you to our sales manager.
conversation.ja_sentence: セールスマネージャーに転送しますね。

conversation.ja_speaker: キャメロン ジャイルズさん
conversation.en_sentence: Please hold.
conversation.ja_sentence: 少々お待ちくださいませ。
素晴らしいアイディアだと思います。
conversation.en_sentence: I think it's a great idea.

conversation.ja_sentence: 我が社は昨年コピー用紙の購入に10,000ドル以上費やしました。
conversation.en_sentence: We spent more than 10,000 dollars on purchasing printer paper last year.

conversation.ja_sentence: インクカートリッジやペーパークリップ、フォルダーを含まずにこの金額です。
conversation.en_sentence: That doesn't even include printer ink, paper clips, and folders.

conversation.ja_sentence: ペーパーレス化を進めることで多額のお金を節約できるでしょう。
conversation.en_sentence: We would save huge sums of money by going paperless.

conversation.ja_sentence: それに書類の保管に場所を取られすぎていますし。
conversation.en_sentence: We also dedicate too much storage space to paperwork.
When we must give our ideas?
conversation.ja_sentence: アイデアを提出するのはいつですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Okay, no problem.
conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました、大丈夫です。

conversation.en_sentence: I guess everyone here also agree.
conversation.ja_sentence: ここにいる皆も賛成だと思いますが。

conversation.en_sentence: Okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい。

conversation.en_sentence: See you.
conversation.ja_sentence: ではまた。

conversation.en_sentence: Sorry, I have an appointment with client next week on Monday.
conversation.ja_sentence: すみません、私は来週の月曜にクライアントとアポがあるんです。

conversation.en_sentence: Can we meet later at around 3 pm?
conversation.ja_sentence: もっと遅く、３時頃に集まれますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Okay then I will submit it to Felix.
conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました、じゃ、フェリックスに渡します。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.
conversation.ja_sentence: 助かります。

conversation.en_sentence: See you.
conversation.ja_sentence: では。

conversation.en_sentence: Hello, I'm Cynthia.
conversation.ja_sentence: こんにちは、シンシアです。

conversation.en_sentence: Actually we received another quotation from another source, and they give us better price than your company.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実は他社からもお見積もりをいただいておりまして、そちらの方が御社よりも安いんですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Their price is cheaper and also they offered us more discount than you.
conversation.ja_sentence: そちらの価格の方が安くて、御社より多くの値引きもしてくれるそうなんです。

conversation.en_sentence: They offered us 15 percent discount.
conversation.ja_sentence: 15％オフをいただいています。

conversation.en_sentence: Okay, good.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですか、良かった。

conversation.en_sentence: What's that cracking sound?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何だこの割れるような音は？

conversation.en_sentence: Something is definitely cracking.
conversation.ja_sentence: なにかが間違いなく割れている。

conversation.en_sentence: This place is a mess!
conversation.ja_sentence: めちゃくちゃだな。

conversation.en_sentence: I've been splashed as well!
conversation.ja_sentence: 私も濡れちゃったよ。

conversation.en_sentence: My cashmere suit is wet!
conversation.ja_sentence: 私のカシミアのスーツ濡れちゃったよ！

conversation.ja_speaker: マイク モストウさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, thank you Chris.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、ありがとう、クリス。

conversation.ja_speaker: マイク モストウさん
conversation.en_sentence: As you may all know, the trade deal was signed earlier this year.
conversation.ja_sentence: 皆さんご存知かと思いますが、今年に入って貿易協定が締結されました。

conversation.ja_speaker: マイク モストウさん
conversation.en_sentence: Although there were some issues along the way, all the government officials involved have made sure things went smoothly.
conversation.ja_sentence: その過程において問題はいくつかありましたが、係わった政府関係者たち全員が確実に物事がスムーズにいくようにしました。

conversation.ja_speaker: マイク モストウさん
conversation.en_sentence: And I'm happy to be here today to have Chris and his team present to you the new trade deal.
conversation.ja_sentence: そして、今日ここにいて、クリスと彼のチームが新貿易協定について発表出来るのを喜ばしく思っています。

conversation.ja_speaker: マイク モストウさん
conversation.en_sentence: Chris, I will hand the floor back to you.
conversation.ja_sentence: クリス、どうぞお話してください。

conversation.ja_speaker: カーティス タッカー
conversation.ja_sentence: おはようございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Good morning.

conversation.ja_speaker: カーティス タッカー
conversation.ja_sentence: F誌記者のカーティス タッカーと申します。
conversation.en_sentence: My name is Curtis Tucker, and I'm a reporter from F magazine.

conversation.ja_speaker: カーティス タッカー
conversation.ja_sentence: プレゼンの中で、この製品の開発に７年かかったことに言及されていました。
conversation.en_sentence: In the presentation, you mentioned spending seven years developing this product.

conversation.ja_speaker: カーティス タッカー
conversation.ja_sentence: 特にご苦労なさった点は何だったと思われますか？
conversation.en_sentence: In your opinion, what was the main challenge?

conversation.ja_speaker: カーティス タッカー
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございました。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私はレーザ部品グループで４年になります。
conversation.en_sentence: I have been with the laser component group for 4 years.

conversation.ja_sentence: 部品を扱うので、レーザそのものを扱うことはほとんどないのですが、ここで学ぶことは実際の仕事に活かせるものでしょうか。
conversation.en_sentence: We deal with components and do not handle lasers themselves much, so I am wondering if I would learn anything that would be useful for my work in this class.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、いつ所属先が変わるかも分からないですし。
conversation.en_sentence: Right, you never know when you might go to another group in the company.

conversation.ja_sentence: 僕は、部品を扱う立場からこのクラスに貢献できるかもしれませんね。
conversation.en_sentence: I might be able to contribute to this class from the position of a component person.

conversation.ja_sentence: 新人の時に受けた研修内容とは少し違うみたいですね。
conversation.en_sentence: The content looks a bit different from when I took a class as a new employee.
What about those spicy tuna sushi rolls?
conversation.ja_sentence: スパイシーマグロ巻き寿司は？

conversation.en_sentence: Aren't those Japanese?
conversation.ja_sentence: 日本料理じゃないの？

conversation.en_sentence: No, the spicy red sauce that they put on the tuna.
conversation.ja_sentence: 違うよ、あのマグロにかけてある赤い辛いソースだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Huh, it must be an American thing.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃああれはアメリカの物なのか。

conversation.en_sentence: They're good.
conversation.ja_sentence: 美味しいんだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Okay, I would like to report about the development progress of our mobile application.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、携帯アプリの開発状況について報告したいです。

conversation.en_sentence: Our mobile application can now be downloaded from the Google Playstore or Appstore.
conversation.ja_sentence: 当社の携帯アプリは今、グーグルプレイストアやアップストアからダウンロードできるようになっています。

conversation.en_sentence: Since this application is still new and I think it needs much improvement, I would like everyone here to download it and give a feedback.
conversation.ja_sentence: このアプリはまだ新しく、多くの改善が必要だと思いますので、皆さんにもダウンロードしてもらって、フィードバックをいただきたいと思います。

conversation.en_sentence: Before we launch this mobile application to the public and broadcast the information to all of our client, I would like to receive feedback from our employees first.
conversation.ja_sentence: 一般公開とクライアント向けの情報公開前に、当社の社員からのフィードバックが欲しいのです。

conversation.en_sentence: Okay, I will broadcast the information after this meeting.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、このミーティングの後に皆に知らせます。

conversation.en_sentence: I agree.
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕も同感だ。

conversation.en_sentence: They've expanded into such a large operation they can no longer cater to the requests of small companies like ours.
conversation.ja_sentence: 事業拡大の結果うちみたいな小企業の要望には応じられない体制になってしまったみたいだな。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I think they squeeze us in between bigger orders, and they don't have time to set up the machines properly.
conversation.ja_sentence: うちの注文は大口注文の間に入れ込んでいるから、マシンをちゃんとセットアップする時間がないんだと思う。

conversation.en_sentence: I think I've heard of them, they use a lot of automation, right?
conversation.ja_sentence: その会社聞いたことあるような気がするな、オートメーションが多いんだよね？

conversation.en_sentence: That all sounds great.
conversation.ja_sentence: 素晴らしいな。

conversation.en_sentence: The pleasure is all mine.
conversation.ja_sentence: こちらこそ。

conversation.en_sentence: I have read some of your papers you have submitted with your resume.
conversation.ja_sentence: 履歴書と一緒に提出していただいた書類に目を通しました。

conversation.en_sentence: It was very impressive.
conversation.ja_sentence: とても素晴らしかったです。

conversation.en_sentence: Are you compensated well enough in any way for your discovery?
conversation.ja_sentence: ご自分の発見には何らかの形で十分に対価を得ていますか？

conversation.en_sentence: I think you have come to the right place.
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたはぴったりな場所に来られたと思いますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Your resume is very interesting.
conversation.ja_sentence: 君の履歴書はとても興味深い。

conversation.en_sentence: You received your PhD 8 years after you set up your own company.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご自分の会社を立ち上げた８年後に博士号を取得していますね。

conversation.en_sentence: That's really impressive.
conversation.ja_sentence: 本当に素晴らしい。

conversation.en_sentence: How have you monetized that?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうやってそれを収益化したんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: So they force you to sell your patent?
conversation.ja_sentence: つまり企業に特許を無理やり売らされる？
私たちのプログラムはどういう方式にしますか？
conversation.en_sentence: How would ours work?

conversation.ja_sentence: アプリやスタンプカードなど色々なやり方がありますが。
conversation.en_sentence: I know there are many different ways to do it, such as an app or a stamp card.

conversation.ja_sentence: 会員への特典があっても良いですね。
conversation.en_sentence: You could also have special deals for members.

conversation.ja_sentence: 会員がカードを持参すればスムージーが１０パーセント割引になる日を設けるとか、そんな感じで。
conversation.en_sentence: Maybe on certain days if a customer brings their card they can get 10 percent off of their smoothie, or something like that.

conversation.ja_sentence: もちろんです。
conversation.en_sentence: Of course.
